memberdef.argsstring: (name creator, name name, ignore< authority > owner, ignore< authority > active)
memberdef.name: newaccount

detaileddescription.para: New account action, called after a new account is created. This code enforces resource-limits rules for new accounts as well as new account naming conventions.

listitem.para: accounts cannot contain '.' symbols which forces all acccounts to be 12 characters long without '.' until a future account auction process is implemented which prevents name squatting.

new accounts must stake a minimal number of tokens (as set in system parameters) therefore, this method will execute an inline buyram from receiver for newacnt in an amount equal to the current new account creation fee.

memberdef.argsstring: (ignore< name > account, ignore< name > permission, ignore< name > parent, ignore< authority > auth)
memberdef.name: updateauth

detaileddescription.para: Update authorization action updates pemission for an account.

parameterdescription.para: - the account for which the permission is updated,
- the permission name which is updated,
- the parent of the permission which is updated,
- the json describing the permission authorization.

detaileddescription.para: Delete authorization action deletes the authorization for an account's permission.

parameterdescription.para: - the account for which the permission authorization is deleted,
- the permission name been deleted.

memberdef.argsstring: (ignore< name > account, ignore< name > code, ignore< name > type, ignore< name > requirement)
memberdef.name: linkauth

detaileddescription.para: Link authorization action assigns a specific action from a contract to a permission you have created. Five system actions can not be linked updateauth, deleteauth, linkauth, unlinkauth, and canceldelay. This is useful because when doing authorization checks, the EOSIO based blockchain starts with the action needed to be authorized (and the contract belonging to), and looks up which permission is needed to pass authorization validation. If a link is set, that permission is used for authoraization validation otherwise then active is the default, with the exception of eosio.any. eosio.any is an implicit permission which exists on every account; you can link actions to eosio.any and that will make it so linked actions are accessible to any permissions defined for the account.

parameterdescription.para: - the permission's owner to be linked and the payer of the RAM needed to store this link,
- the owner of the action to be linked,
- the action to be linked,
- the permission to be linked.

memberdef.argsstring: (ignore< name > account, ignore< name > code, ignore< name > type)
memberdef.name: unlinkauth

detaileddescription.para: Unlink authorization action it's doing the reverse of linkauth action, by unlinking the given action.

parameterdescription.para: - the owner of the permission to be unlinked and the receiver of the freed RAM,
- the owner of the action to be unlinked,
- the action to be unlinked.

detaileddescription.para: Cancel delay action cancels a deferred transaction.

parameterdescription.para: - the permission that authorizes this action,
- the deferred transaction id to be cancelled.

memberdef.argsstring: (name account, uint8_t vmtype, uint8_t vmversion, const std::vector< char > &code)
memberdef.name: setcode

detaileddescription.para: Set code action sets the contract code for an account.

parameterdescription.para: - the account for which to set the contract code.
- reserved, set it to zero.
- reserved, set it to zero.
- the code content to be set, in the form of a blob binary..

detaileddescription.para: Set abi action sets the abi for contract identified by account name. Creates an entry in the abi_hash_table index, with account name as key, if it is not already present and sets its value with the abi hash. Otherwise it is updating the current abi hash value for the existing account key.

parameterdescription.para: - the name of the account to set the abi for
- the abi hash represented as a vector of characters

memberdef.argsstring: (ignore< uint128_t > sender_id, ignore< std::vector< char > > sent_trx)
memberdef.name: onerror

detaileddescription.para: On error action, notification of this action is delivered to the sender of a deferred transaction when an objective error occurs while executing the deferred transaction. This action is not meant to be called directly.

parameterdescription.para: - the id for the deferred transaction chosen by the sender,
- the deferred transaction that failed.

detaileddescription.para:
Set privilege action allows to set privilege status for an account (turn it on/off).
account
- the account to set the privileged status for.
is_priv
- 0 for false, > 0 for true.

memberdef.argsstring: (name account, int64_t ram_bytes, int64_t net_weight, int64_t cpu_weight)
memberdef.name: setalimits

detaileddescription.para: Sets the resource limits of an account

parameterdescription.para: - name of the account whose resource limit to be set
- ram limit in absolute bytes
- fractionally proportionate net limit of available resources based on (weight / total_weight_of_all_accounts)
- fractionally proportionate cpu limit of available resources based on (weight / total_weight_of_all_accounts)

detaileddescription.para: Set producers action, sets a new list of active producers, by proposing a schedule change, once the block that contains the proposal becomes irreversible, the schedule is promoted to "pending" automatically. Once the block that promotes the schedule is irreversible, the schedule will become "active".

parameterdescription.para: - New list of active producers to set

detaileddescription.para: Set params action, sets the blockchain parameters. By tuning these parameters, various degrees of customization can be achieved.

parameterdescription.para: - New blockchain parameters to set

detaileddescription.para: Require authorization action, checks if the account name from passed in as param has authorization to access current action, that is, if it is listed in the actionâ€™s allowed permissions vector.

parameterdescription.para: - the account name to authorize

detaileddescription.para: Activate action, activates a protocol feature

parameterdescription.para: - hash of the protocol feature to activate.

detaileddescription.para: Require activated action, asserts that a protocol feature has been activated

parameterdescription.para: - hash of the protocol feature to check for activation.

detaileddescription.para: The eosio.bios is the first sample of system contract provided by block.one through the EOSIO platform. It is a minimalist system contract because it only supplies the actions that are absolutely critical to bootstrap a chain and nothing more. This allows for a chain agnostic approach to bootstrapping a chain.

Just like in the eosio.system sample contract implementation, there are a few actions which are not implemented at the contract level (newaccount, updateauth, deleteauth, linkauth, unlinkauth, canceldelay, onerror, setabi, setcode), they are just declared in the contract so they will show in the contract's ABI and users will be able to push those actions to the chain via the account holding the eosio.system contract, but the implementation is at the EOSIO core level. They are referred to as EOSIO native actions.
